definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The original call was at eight thirty-two.
sentences.chinese: 第一个电话是在八点三十二分。

sentences.english: The lightest-weight stars are red dwarfs. They can be as small as one-twelfth the mass of our Sun.
sentences.chinese: 最轻的是红矮星，它们只有太阳质量的十二分之一。

sentences.english: Nine fifty-two on the clock above the refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 冰箱上的钟已指到九点五十二分。

sentences.english: Each animal also represents two hours or one-twelfth of every day.
sentences.chinese: 并且代表一天中的十二分之一，也就是两个小时。

sentences.english: The odds are about one in twelve that a child will be colorblind .
sentences.chinese: 色盲在儿童中的比例是十二分之一。

sentences.english: China- bashers have introduced a dozen bills in the new Congress.
sentences.chinese: “对华强硬派”议员已经向国会提交了十二分议案。

sentences.english: Supenova: this is Red Dwarf. We actually have one.
sentences.chinese: 最轻的是红矮星，它们只有太阳质量的十二分之一。

definition: to raise one's spirits/to take courage
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to do at all costs/to make an all-out effort
to relax/to relax efforts/to slack off/to take it easy/complacent/undisciplined
lit. the eyes watch six roads and the ears listen in all directions/to be observant and alert (idiom)
pinyin: yan3 guan1 liu4 lu4 er3 ting1 ba1 fang1

definition: to gather one's spirits/to pull oneself together
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
